entry.name: parent
entry.title: :parent Selector
entry.desc: Select all elements that are the parent of another element, including text nodes.

longdesc.p: One important thing to note regarding the use of :parent (and :empty) is that child elements include text nodes.

The W3C recommends that the

element have at least one child node, even if that child is merely text (see http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/text.html#edef-P). Some other elements, on the other hand, are empty (i.e. have no children) by definition: , ,
, and

, for example.

example.desc: Finds all tds with children, including text.
